page.title: 02SCENERY
page.content:
The land is quite{steep}and forms an interesting mixture of{hills and {valleys. }The height varies from{165m in the N.E. corner of the block to under{30m}in the Lynher valley at Newton Barton. The most striking feature is the oval shaped hill at{Cadson Bury}whose flat top was altered by ancient man to make a{hill fort.
{Natural woodland}still covers about 20% of the area but most of the land is farmscape. The many{hedges divide the land into a{patchwork of {fields,}mostly green but with dashes of yellow and brown in summer. Man's other activities have hardly changed the landscape - even houses are hidden by trees or dwarfed by the open countryside.
